author: nanook
title: Getting Defensive: Two Issues Plaguing Oakland
summary: The Oakland Raiders need to play smart, sound, defensive football, if they want to win.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Gay father is found GUILTY of murdering his 18-month-old daughter
summary: A gay father who murdered his adopted 18-month-old daughter was visited by social services 15 times but they still raised no concerns - despite finding out she had broken her leg and had 'fallen down the stairs'. Matthew Scully-Hicks, 31, subjected little Elsie Scully-Hicks to months of horrific assaults and was heard shouting 'shut the f*** up' at her in his home in Llandaff, Cardiff.  The toddler suffered a string of suspicious injuries before Scully-Hicks eventually killed her just two weeks after she was formally adopted by the fitness instructor and his husband Craig, 36. Scully-Hicks also shook the toddler while he was looking after her and threw her against a hard floor.  Social workers

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Changing of guard coming, if not already here, at running back for Panthers
summary: David Newton ESPN Staff Writer Close Covered Panthers, NFL for 11 years More than 25 years experience covering NFL, college football and NASCAR Joined ESPN in 2006 Follow on Twitter CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- Fans booed Sunday when Carolina Panthers running back Jonathan Stewart was tackled for no gain on his first carry after fumbling on the two previous series against Atlanta. They cheered when the 2015 Pro Bowl selection trotted to the sideline. Some fans obviously have given up on the 30-year-old back, who in Week 4 became the organization's all-time leading rusher with (then) 6,967 yards, but the Panthers haven't. “We believe in Jonathan," coach Ron Rivera said Monday. “That is why we brought him

author: DeltaBravo
title: Steelers ready to 'evolve' with man coverage entering crucial stretch
summary: Jeremy Fowler ESPN Staff Writer Close ESPN staff writer Previously a college football reporter for CBSSports.com University of Florida graduate Follow on Twitter PITTSBURGH -- Aaron Rodgers. Deshaun Watson. Andrew Luck. All are talented signal-callers that the Steelers' secondary doesn't have to face in the second half of the season due to injury. Coupled with Tom Brady and Marcus Mariota on the latter part of the schedule, the Steelers had prepared for an onslaught of talented passers that would require a versatile coverage plan. Now, Pittsburgh is left to process the quarterback in front of them, who, this week, is Indianapolis Colts quarterback Jacoby Brissett. "Good for us, bad for them,"

author: nanook
title: Watch: Fight breaks out in stands at Raiders, Dolphins game
summary: A fight broke out at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami between Raiders and Dolphins fans, with a couple of fans of the home team teaming against an Oakland fan who appears to be talking smack while wearing a Derek Carr jersey. Below fans can find footage of the incident shared by Instagram user Toine the Don this morning shortly before 5 a.m. PT. Be advised that the material is not suitable for work or children (NSFW). Without being able to see the entire incident from before and after the footage was cut by the IG user, it's difficult to firmly determine when the exchange of words actually began or who was truly at fault. However, from the footage that fans do have at their disposal at this time, it

author: captainunderoos
title: Dallas Cowboys: Dez Bryant, Bryce Butler complain about bothersome sun
summary: FRISCO, Texas - Dallas Cowboys wide receivers Dez Bryant and Brice Butler both had second-quarter drops in Sunday's 28-17 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs. Both blamed it on being blinded by the sun coming in through glass windows behind the west end zone at AT&T Stadium. "The sun really is that big a deal," Bryant said. "I was going across as I was going up. The ball caught the light and I lost it a little bit. I told coach, 'Hey man there's nothing I can do about that one.' These fans can go to hell today." Bryant said he has talked owner Jerry Jones about it. "Hopefully, one of these days he'll fix it," Bryant said. "I don't know what it is. It's a big problem." Butler also lost a deep

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: What Planet Does Chuck Pagano Live On?
summary: If there's one thing you can say about Chuck Pagano, he never lacks for the ability to give local media a pep talk. What's more is it feels as though he's a little delusional as well. Some may not say that's a revelation, however, there it is. While I'm not one for endless negativity, I simply don't understand his mindset in the midst of the current state of the team. Let me explain. Let's start with the fact that the Colts have shown spurts of solid football this season, right? They have gotten out to several halftime leads. Jacoby Brissett does present some optimism for the Colts in terms of a quality backup for Andrew Luck, or some would even say for trade bait in the future. The defense is

author: nanook
title: Eagles injury updates on Ronald Darby, Sidney Jones, and Tim Jernigan
summary: The Philadelphia Eagles are 8-1 entering their Week 10 bye. It's time for players to rest up and get ready for the final seven remaining regular season games. The good news for the Eagles is that reinforcements appear to be on the way for the final stretch run. Here's an update on the team's injury situation. RONALD DARBY Darby has been out since suffering a dislocated ankle injury in Week 1. He returned to practice leading up to the Eagles' Week 7 game but he's been limited in practice ever since. Now it seems like Darby will be able to return after the bye and play against the Dallas Cowboys in Week 11. He essentially indicated as much on Twitter. Les Bowen of the Daily News confirmed the good

author: DeltaBravo
title: Mike McCarthy: Packers “very concerned” about Bryan Bulaga injury
summary: The reunion of the Green Bay Packers starting offensive line was brief Monday night as Bryan Bulaga left the game with a knee injury in the fourth quarter. author: DeltaBravo
title: Week 10 Fantasy Sleepers: McCown adds to multi-TD streak in Tampa
summary: Josh McCown has certainly made the rounds, but this week he's planted firm roots inside the QB top-10.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Studs & Duds from the Lions' week 9 victory over the Packers
summary: The Detroit Lions traveled to Green Bay for a Week 9 Monday Night Football game—and came back with a huge victory, thanks to one of their most complete performances of the year. In a game that was dominated by the Lions, separating players successes and failures is difficult to do. The STUDS elevated their game a step above the rest, while the DUDS end up being called out on a few bad plays even if they had several good ones as well. After a brutal stretch of matchups against elite cornerbacks to start the season, Marvin Jones is starting to catch fire at the right time. He's accounted for double-digit targets, and a minimum of six catches and 96 yards in each of his last three games. Jones gets

author: nanook
title: Texans have discussed signing Colin Kaepernick: 'Is that a problem?'
summary: Colin Kaepernick remains unsigned, but Texans head coach Bill O'Brien admitted Monday that his team has considered signing the ex-49ers quarterback.

author: captainunderoos
title: Patriots Quarterback Tom Brady Admits He Might Not Be A Pats Lifer
summary: Everyone assumes the one player the New England Patriots would never trade is quarterback Tom Brady. After all, he is arguably the greatest gunslinger in the history of the sport. Oddly enough, Tom Brady doesn't exactly agree with people that he's untouchable. In fact, he can envision a time when the Patriots force him out. “Well, there is no guarantee in the NFL,” Brady told Jim Gray of Westwood One on Monday night. “I think that's just what I've seen over a long period of time. I certainly hope I play for the Patriots. I hope they want me that long.” “Some incredible players have moved teams,” Brady said. “I don't want it to sound that it's impossible for me go somewhere else. That's just not

author: nanook
title: Week 10 Fantasy Football rankings: Lineup cheat sheet
summary: Fresh off a bye, Tom Brady and the Patriots go up against a Broncos defense that just got shredded by Carson Wentz. See how our fantasy gurus stack all the positions for Week 10.

author: nanook
title: Vikings look smart for WR decisions made in offseason
summary: This offseason, the Vikings got some some flack for letting Cordarrelle Patterson walk. Patterson signed with the Raiders. The Vikings didn't fight for Charles Johnson, either, allowing him to sign with the Panthers. Through nine games, Patters has 14 catches for just 69 yards to go with 10 rushes for 124 yards and two touchdowns. He's more of a gimmick player than anything in Oakland. He was primarily used as a kick returner with the Vikings. In Oakland, he has no touchdowns while averaging 30 yards per return. Good, but probably not worth $8.5 million over two years. Johnson is on the injured reserved with the Panthers after signing a one-year, $1.675 million deal with Carolina this offseason.

author: third_watch
title: Kaepernick’s attorney fires back at NFL’s claim that QB failed to respond to Goodell invite
summary: Perhaps unintended, the back and forth between Colin Kaepernick’s camp and the NFL has provided a window into the frustration that is developing between the league and players in recent weeks.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: The Packers are unwatchable without Aaron Rodgers
summary: The Packers were 4-1 when Aaron Rodgers broke his collarbone, but they've lost every game since then, and in boring fashion.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: State of the Bears: Vic Fangio's future
summary: Dominant defense and an inept passing offense. No one does it better than the Chicago Bears. It's practically tradition ingrained deep into the franchise. Despite the efforts by Chicago to bring along Mitchell Trubisky slowly, or curtail their young quarterback altogether, a newly reinvigorated elite defense has sprung up in the headlines lately. Whether it be coaching or talent (it's primarily the talent), the standard of defensive play that Chicago is used to when it comes to the Bears has returned over the past month. A refreshing ideal in the face of recent incompetence on that side of the ball, no doubt. For frame of reference, in October, Chicago's defense allowed four total offensive touchdowns

author: captainunderoos
title: Shuffle Up: Wideout and tight end fantasy prices, rest of season
summary: With quarterbacks dropping left and right, it's been a horrible year for the receivers. Let's try to reprice the wideouts and tight ends.

author: third_watch
title: Disaster against Lions offers sobering view of Packers
summary: In the NFL, coaches get fired. They get fired frequently. They get fired suspiciously. They get fired maliciously. They get fired vociferously. Except in Green Bay, where it seems NFL coaches enjoy the job security of a tenured humanities professor. Don't expect the Packers to fire anyone anytime soon, but the seat warmers should be on full blast. Dom Capers has been coordinating the defense since 2009, and while he found early success, his defenses have progressively worsened as the team has had more time to draft and develop talent to fit his 3-4 system. In the last five seasons, including this season, Capers' defenses have ranked 25th, 15th, 15th, 22nd and 25th in total yards. Using the metric

author: nanook
title: Two dominant lines? How the Cowboys transformed a winning O-line strategy to ignite the pass rush
summary: SportsDay Cowboys insider David Moore joined SportsDayDFW "Ballzy" podcast hosts Kevin Sherrington, Barry Horn and Evan Grant to talk Cowboys, Dak Prescott vs. Carson Wentz and the loss of Dan Bailey recently. He retired, he was never right with his knee; and then what they did is went: 'You know what? Let's just do in the defensive line what we've done in the offensive line.' We [put] our

author: third_watch
title: The GOP Tax Bill Would (Accidentally) Help Renters
summary: WASHINGTON ― Controversial provisions abound in the Republican tax plan: a massive corporate tax cut, the repeal of the estate tax, and the end of a tax deduction for medical expenses, for example.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Week 10 NFL picks straight up: Patriots shut out Broncos; 49ers, Browns stay winless
summary: The Chiefs' bye week provides an opportunity to discuss, again, how the last undefeated team doesn't always make noise in the playoffs. Since starting 5-0, the Chiefs have lost three of four and have fallen behind the Steelers and Patriots in the AFC standings. Remember, the last team to lose last season, the Vikings, started 5-0 and then missed the playoffs. Meanwhile, a team that started 0-2, the Saints, have won six straight since, are in first place in their division and are in position to follow two recent teams (2015 Seahawks, 2014 Colts) in overcoming those starts to reach the postseason. And the Saints are not on a bye this week — they get a tough road matchup in Buffalo against a Bills

author: nanook
title: Michael Lewis, author of Moneyball: 'Short the NFL'
summary: Michael Lewis, author of bestselling books like "The Big Short," "The Blind Side," and "Moneyball," says the next 'big short' could be the NFL.
